title.narrative: 6.14 SOCIAL POLICY & ECONOMIC ANALYSIS

description.narrative: EAPR has strengthened capacity to influence allocation and management of regional and domestic plans, budgets and finances for children and adolescents., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EAPR effectively leverages and utilises resources, strategic partnerships, innovations, data and evidence to drive results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EAPR has strengthened capacity to influence allocation and management of regional and domestic plans, budgets and finances forchildren and adolescents.

description.narrative: During past years Social Policy continued to guide the analysis and response to CO and RO to the socio-economic impact of COVID-19 in the region in areas of social protection, Public Finance for Children, and child poverty. In terms of Public finance for children, SPEA supported the growth of the portfolio in the countries in the region, maintaining the quality of PFM based evidence generation and advocacy, as well as putting the foundations for a Regional strategy for Public finance for EAP. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/03/2022
